Pre-Game Insights: The New York Mets lead the series 1-0 ahead of Game 2.
The Philadelphia Phillies have a strong home record (54-27) and perform well when scoring five or more runs.
The New York Mets have a.415 team slugging percentage, the fifth-best in the NL.
The season series between the two teams is tied 7-7.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game is the 15th meeting between the teams this season.
Key players include Bryce Harper and Nicholas Castellanos for the Phillies, and Francisco Lindor and Mark Vientos for the Mets.
Recent performance stats: Phillies 4-6, Mets 5-5 over the last 10 games.
Others: Injuries: Phillies have Rodolfo Castro, Spencer Turnbull, Luis Ortiz on the IL; Mets have Paul Blackburn, Christian Scott, Jeff McNeil, Sean Reid-Foley, Dedniel Nunez, Drew Smith, Brooks Raley, Ronny Mauricio on the IL.
